bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Pedro Nogueira, September 15, 1952

div1.p: Hench is anxious to hear about the plans for the dedication of Camp Lazear. He wants to have American representatives invited and sends the names of the officers of the Walter Reed Memorial Association.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Pedro Nogueira, September 15, 1952
div1.opener:
September 15, 1952
Dr. Pedro Nogueira
Marti 219, Marianao
Habana, Cuba
My dear Pedro:
div1.p:
I am anxious to hear about the plans for the dedication of Camp Lazear.
Are you still planning to dedicate it the last of September? What was
decided about the invitations? I am as anxious as you to have American
representatives invited and lend their full support to this venture so
that the Americans can know what you all have done in this matter.

In my previous letter I suggested that your committee on arrangements
might wish to send an invitation to the officers of the Walter Reed
Memorial Association. Here are their names and addresses:
President: Col. J. F. Siler
2220 20th Street N.W.
Washington, D. C.
Vice President: Dr. P. S. Hench
Secretary: General Albert G. Love
2709 Wisconsin Avenue N.W.
Washington 7, D. C.

There are seven additional members of the Board of Managers of the Walter
Reed Memorial Association, most of whom are high-ranking officers of the
American Army or Navy. Should you wish their names and addresses, I can
send them.

Is there anything further that I can do to help you in the matter of the
dedication. I know that time is short.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
